description:
Historical connections
Vice Admiral Fitzroy /Charles Darwin/Crystal Palace Great Exhibition
(Grave within Church grounds),
Isambard Kingdom Brunel,
Felix Mendelssohn, Marie Tussauds to name but a few. 
Famous artist Camille Pissarro painted local scenes .

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs:
Built in 1827-1829  Parish of Norwood takes its name from the Great North Wood.
Many Historical Figures lead to the outstanding interest of this Church.
Charles Dickens who mentioned All Saints in his book David Copperfield.
Camille Pissarro famous impressionist painter.
Vice-Admiral Robert Fitzroy buried at All Saints who sailed with Charles Darwin to the the Galapagos Islands and founded the modern barometer.
Felix Mendelssohn who stayed in the area and played on the organ here.

location.address: All Saints Church, Church Road, SE19 3EP
travel_info: Train: Crystal Palace, Norwood Junction, West Norwood

Additional travel info: Parking available in Church Yard.
Buses stop right outside the Church.

name: All Saints Church
